site_name: Land to rear of 1-13 Kenley Gardens
decision_conditions: The proposal would, by reason of its layout on the plot provide unsatisfactory access to the detriment of amenity and contrary to Policy DC61 DC32 and DC34 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD.

The access by way of its width length and sight distances is unsatisfactory for emergency purposes and would create an unsafe living environment for future occupiers and contrary to Policy 7.13 of the London Plan.

The proposed development would, by reason of its position and proximity to neighbouring properties as well as the likely loss of existing mature and semi-mature trees, cause overlooking and loss of privacy, noise and disturbance from the carrying of daily life as well as traffic arriving manoeuvring on and leaving the site, which would have a serious and adverse effect on the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD.

The proposed development does not provide for adequate refuse storage facilities and therefore is in contravention of  and DC36 of the Development Control Policies DPD and Policy 6.9 of the London Plan.

Please be advised that approval of this application (either by London Borough of Havering, or subsequently by PINS if allowed on appeal following a refusal by London Borough of Havering) will attract a liability payment of £26, 400 subject to indexation of Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL). This charge has been levied under s.206 of the Planning Act 2008 and includes both the Mayor of London's CIL and Havering Council's CIL.
London Borough of Havering, as CIL collecting authority, has responsibility for the collection of the Mayoral CIL, in addition to Havering's CIL, on commencement of the development.

Your proposal is subject to a CIL Liability Notice indicating a levy of £4, 400 for the application, based on the Mayoral CIL levy rate for Havering of £25/sq.m plus £22, 000 based on Havering's charging rate for residential of £125/sq.m (Zone A) and the floorspace of 176m².
